content:
Hi @Richard Ettema - I'm getting errors when trying to expand the "extensional-case-2" Value Set. - 

Validation of response body against profile 'http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/ValueSet' by FHIR specification's Validation Engine produced the following results:
ERROR: Exception validating resource ValueSet. null.
Description:    Confirm that the returned ValueSet conforms to the base FHIR specification.
Definition:
{
  "description" : "Confirm that the returned ValueSet conforms to the base FHIR specification.",
  "validateProfileId" : "ValueSetProfile",
  "warningOnly" : false,
  "stopTestOnFail" : true
}

Seems strange that it's only happening for this one VS, which I haven't changed for years. I then tested the response using the latest version of the Validator and the relevant profile and all was OK.

Any ideas what has upset Touchstone?

@Peter Jordan - Thanks for the heads up. We just deployed our latest Touchstone 5.5.0 release over this past weekend. Let me take your failed test execution results and attempt to re-create the issue in our QA environment. I have created an internal support ticket TSS-795 to track this issue.

@Peter Jordan - I have completed my analysis and am able to re-create this issue in my local environment. A correction has been identified and will be prioritized for release within the next couple of weeks. We (Touchstone Support) will inform you of this release via email once it has been deployed.

@Peter Jordan - We just completed a supplemental deployment to Touchstone over this past weekend where the correction for this issue is now available. Please re-execute your terminology tests to confirm. Thanks.
